III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
In one of sixteen updated service plans reviewed, one was one day late. The report
was dated 1/31/22 – 4/30/22 and was completed on 5/1/2022.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED INTERIM, 2021
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements:
There were no MISEP violations.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
FOM 722-08C Caregiver

The individual activities required by the foster
parent/caregiver to meet the specific individual needs of
the child placed in their home are included in the PATP.
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP

acknowledges and agrees to the activities required to meet
the needs of the child in their care. Additionally, the PATP

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the special investigation
#2022C040013 initiated on 2/18/2022. The agency was found in violation with
Rule 324 (a) and (b) Reevaluation. There was no repeat violation for this rule
during this review period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan on for their Interim inspection dated
7/16/2021. The agency was in violation with Rules 306, 310, 319,324 (8), 326, 327,
413, 417, 418, 604, and DHHS policies 722-3E, 722-06B,722-06H, 722-06I, 722-08C,
5

722-08E, 722-09, ADM 200, 300, and 710. The agency submitted a corrective action
plan however, there were two repeat violations. Overall, the agency did very well with
violations for this review.
VII. DCWL FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS:
Concerns:
A visit was conducted at the home of foster parent, the caregiver of the foster child. The
foster parent and her son lives in a one-bedroom home next door to her parents in
Wayne, MI. Her parents live on Merriman Rd., Wayne, MI. According to the foster
parent and foster child, the foster child sleeps next door at the foster parent’s parents
home; due to the foster parent having a one-bedroom home. The foster parent stated
the agency is aware of the sleeping arrangements and the foster care worker completed
criminal background checks on all household members. Information regarding the foster
child not sleeping at the foster parent's home, a home study for the parents home and
criminal background and central registry checks couldn’t be verified in MiSACWIS. The
foster parent also stated she was informed that the foster child could not be placed in
her parents home as a fictive kin placement. There are three adult household members
that reside at the home of the foster parent’s parents home.
The following safety issues must be verified:
- Criminal background and central registry checks must be done on the three adult
members of the house hold and:
- A home study to verify safety of the home should be done at the home located on
Merriman Road, Wayne, MI.
Solution:
The ICHATs and criminal record checks were completed but not uploaded in
MISACWIS. ICHATS have been uploaded in the provider documents section.
The fictive kin is not willing to do a home study at this time. In order to address this
issue timely, the agency has completed a safety plan that the youth will not spend the
night in the home until a home study is completed. This safety plan was signed and
uploaded in the foster care MiSACWIS general documents hyperlink.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend that Ennis for Children - Pontiac will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
